subject: Gardening
title: Joseph Banks and the Endeavour
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Joseph Banks and the Endeavour.

hook.text: In 1768, a wealthy 25-year-old paid his own way onto Captain Cook's ship. He returned with 30,000 specimens.

buildup.text: Joseph Banks brought along artists, assistants, and two greyhounds on the HMS Endeavour's voyage to the Pacific.

discovery.text: Banks collected specimens from Brazil, Tahiti, New Zealand, and Australiaâ€”most unknown to European science.

twist.text: Australia's Botany Bay is named after Banks' collecting frenzy there. His plants helped justify British colonization.

climax.text: Banks became president of the Royal Society and shaped British science for 42 yearsâ€”all from one voyage.

punchline.text: One rich kid's gap year reshaped global botany.

quiz.question: Why is Botany Bay in Australia named 'Botany Bay'?
options: Joseph Banks collected so many plant specimens there
Aboriginal people used the bay for medicinal herb gathering
Captain Cook planted the first European garden there
